greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Middle column of rule-30 1-D cellular automaton, from a lone 1 cell.
comment: A092539(n) gives the value of prefix of length n+1, seen as a binary number. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jun 08 2013
Also middle column of rule 86 1-D cellular automaton, from a lone 1 cell, as rule 86 is the mirror image of rule 30. - _Antti Karttunen_, Oct 03 2019
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..100000 (terms 0..10000 from Reinhard Zumkeller)
Erica Jen, Global properties of cellular automata, Journal of Statistical Physics 43 (1986), pp 219-242.
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Elementary Cellular Automaton.
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Random Number
Xiangdong Wen, A Billion Bits of the Center Column of the Rule 30 Cellular Automaton, 2019
Stephen Wolfram, A Million Bits of the Center Column of the Rule 30 Cellular Automaton, 2017
Index entries for sequences related to cellular automata
formula: For n>= 2, a(n) = (A328100(n) OR A328101(n)) XOR A328101(1+n). ["Sideways evaluation"]
program: a051023 n = a070950 n n  -- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jun 06 2013
\\ Or for fast creation of b-files:
A051023write(up_to) = { my(s=1, n=0); for(n=0,up_to, write("b051023.txt", n, " ", ((s>>n)%2)); s = A269160(s)); }; \\ _Antti Karttunen_, Oct 03 2019
xref: Cf. A327974 (adjacent bits xored), A327982 (partial sums), A327983 (run lengths).
Characteristic function of A327984 (gives the positions of ones in this sequence), A327985 (positions of zeros).
Cf. also A328100, A328101, A328102 (neighbor columns).
results.author: _Eric W. Weisstein_
ext: Corrected from 64th term by Daniel B. Cristofani (cristofd(AT)hevanet.com), Jan 07 2004
